events.name: National Engineers Day 2016
events.description:
Engineering will come alive this weekend at the HDB Hub at Toa Payoh! Join youths across Singapore to imagine, create and innovate the future through engineering.
 
From electrifying multimedia performances to workshops ushering you into the future of engineering, NED 2016 is the place for uncovering the marvels of engineering and the exciting opportunities in an engineering career. The event is proudly organised by The Institution of Engineers, Singapore (IES).
 
Don’t miss the final rounds of the second Energy Innovation Challenge jointly organised by IES and the Science Centre Singapore whereby student teams from across Singapore and the region will showcase solutions demonstrating the use of alternative energy for humankind. Be the first to find out which teams will win claim the championship titles! 
Date:
Saturday 23 July – Sunday 24 July 2016
Time:
0900am – 5:00pm
Venue:
Toa Payoh HDB Hub Atrium 480 Lor 6 Toa Payoh Singapore 310480
events.location: Toa Payoh HDB Hub, 480 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh, Singapore 310480

events.name: Deep Learning Workshop
events.description: NOTE: This workshop will require the use of a laptop with virtualbox installed. If you rsvp, please bring your laptop on the day to take part; attendance will not be taken without a laptop. RSVP will only open on 18th July, Monday (12pm) and closes on 22th July (12pm).  For our July meetup, we're excited to have Martin Andrews share about deep learning! Deep Learning is a hot topic, but has a steep initial learning curve. There will be code. Lots of code. To ease the pain, a pre-configured virtual machine will be handed out, so that participants can run it on their own laptops using cross-platform open-source VirtualBox. Bring a laptop with VirtualBox installed! The workshop will start from the very basics (with a little mathematics), and quickly progress to getting hands-on with open source software including the training of a deep network on simple problems. This will be followed by a more in-depth portion : Using a pre-built Virtual Machine, run within VirtualBox, participants will experiment with a much larger pre-trained models, and get an understanding of two application areas relevant to datascientists (expected to be : image classification and anamoly detection). While parts of this are very technical, the models (inside the Virtual Machine) are all in Jupyter (fka iPython) notebooks, making interaction straightforward. However, participants should install VirtualBox on their laptops beforehand, or expect to be mocked... 9.30am - 10.00am: Networking [casual] 10.00am - 11.00am: Sharing on the basics of deep learning and the math behind it [core] 11.00am - 11.15am: Break 11.15am - 12.30pm: Hands-on, including training of a deep network for simple problems [hardcore] [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from:newbie - casual - core - hardcore.
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), 90 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: Singapore Science Festival: Visual SG: Beauty in Patterns
events.description:
South East Asia’s signature Visualisation Festival, Visual SG, presents a full on visual spectacle of data through the lens of artistic and creative expression. With a line-up of interactive displays, forums and workshops, a highlight includes unwrapping and exploring an Egyptian mummy using an interactive touch table.
 Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre Singapore apply
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: Singapore Science Festival: Visual SG Public Lecture: Digital Planetarium Show
events.description:
Listen to Carter Emmart, Director of Astrovisualisation, American Museum of Natural History present the Digital Planetarium Show
Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre Singapore apply. Pre-registration required www.sciencefest.sg/partner-events/visual-sg-exhibition-digital-planetarium-show.html
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: Visual SG Public Lecture: The Artist and The Scientists
events.description:
Palaeontologist Patricia Vickers-Rich and Thomas Rich with Artist Peter Trusler of Monash University will talk about a diverse collection of paintings and drawings produced for, or inspired by, the biological and geological sciences. 
Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre apply. Pre-registration required www.sciencefest.sg/partner-events/visual-sg-exhibition-artist-and-scientists.html
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: Singapore Shapeways Meetup
events.description: Held in conjunction with the Singapore 3D Printing Meetup at our new Studio in Liang Court #B1-07! We now have a dedicated showcase of many of the latest models and materials, some of which we have showcased at the recent Singapore Maker Faire 2016! As some of you may have missed that out, we will now have a permanent display of these pieces in the studio, so don't miss the chance to check them out and see what possibilities are out there with 3d printing with Shapeways! Also, when you're here with us, do go crazy snapping pics of the stuff! Do also share photos on Instagram, Twitter, etc, tagging Shapeways using @Shapeways or #Shapeways!
events.location: Funbie Studios, Liang Court, #B1-07, 177 River Valley Road, Singapore
